alert.note: Alert for Benton; DeSoto; Marshall; Panola; Quitman; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 11:52PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Lee, south central Crittenden, DeSoto, Marshall, Tunica, Tate, northwestern Benton, northern Quitman, northern Panola, southern Fayette, southwestern Hardeman and southeastern Shelby Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1152 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Eads to near Eudora to near Lexa. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bartlett, Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Hernando, Senatobia, Holly Springs, Cordova, Memphis, Lamar, Lakeland, Arlington, Coldwater, Byhalia, Como, Walls, Tunica and Crenshaw. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for eastern Arkansas...northeastern and northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Benton; DeSoto; Marshall; Panola; Quitman; Tate; Tunica
